definition: saliva/sweat/a ferry crossing/a ford (river crossing)/abbr. for Tianjin 天津
saliva/sweat/a ferry crossing/a ford (river crossing)/abbr. for Tianjin 天津
with keen interest (idiom)/with great pleasure/with gusto/eagerly
erhua variant of 鹹津津|咸津津[xian2 jin1 jin1]

sentences.english: His face was sallow and shiny with sweat.
He turned to an editorial and began reading it with interest.
sentences.chinese: 他翻到裏面的一篇論文，津津有味地讀起來。

sentences.english: Chinese boys watch a cartoon at a toy fair in Beijing on July 29 2010.
sentences.chinese: 北京的玩具展會場中，兩小男孩津津有味地在看卡通。

sentences.english: Ray was so hungrythathe enjoyed every morsel of the stale bread.
sentences.chinese: 瑞因太飢餓了，所以津津有味地喫每一口乾硬的麪包。

sentences.english: The bird enjoyed a dinner of flatfish…
sentences.chinese: 小鳥先津津有味地吞進一條比目魚。

sentences.english: In Rock, a cliff out of a stone, have been talking.
sentences.chinese: 在南巖，一座伸出懸崖的石雕，向來被人們津津樂道。

sentences.english: She was overjoyed and rewarded the redcoat with a goblet of wine, which he drank with relish.
sentences.chinese: 那女士高興極了，奉酒一杯，那英兵喝得津津有味。

sentences.english: His hair was spiked, his shirt, sweaty.
sentences.chinese: 他的頭髮支楞着，襯衫汗津津的。
克勞斯津津有味地體驗着世人的關注。

sentences.english: He grabbed onto her sweat-slickened arm.
sentences.chinese: 他抓住她那汗津津的手臂。

sentences.english: He hasn't stopped enthusing about his holiday since he returned.
sentences.chinese: 他度假歸來，對假日情趣仍津津樂道。

sentences.english: He takes great delight in eating lobster.
sentences.chinese: 他津津有味地喫着大龍蝦。

sentences.english: The teacher regaled the children with some fairy tales.
sentences.chinese: 老師講了些神話故事，孩子們聽得津津有味。

sentences.english: Yet Liu remembers her soldiering days with relish.
sentences.chinese: 然而，劉天佑回憶起那些日子仍然津津有味。

sentences.english: The girls were eating away at the melon seeds, chatting.
sentences.chinese: 姑娘們一邊聊天，一邊在津津有問地嗑着瓜子。

sentences.english: Not only I but also she is enjoying the film.
sentences.chinese: 不僅我而且她都在津津樂道地看電影。

definition: variant of 熱乎乎|热乎乎[re4 hu1 hu1]
perspiration/sweat/CL:滴[di1],頭|头[tou2],身[shen1]/to be speechless (out of helplessness, embarrassment etc) (Internet slang used as an interjection)
see 可汗[ke4 han2], 汗國|汗国[han2 guo2]
